intro: Laserpitium prutenicum var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered prutian grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, narrow leaves and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is native to Central Europe and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The species is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological niche.
